item.title: GOPNIK AND THE SLAV SQUAT
item.description: Description Have you ever seen a Russian in a tracksuit ( Adidas or something resembling it), a beer bottle in hand, cigarette hanging from their lips, squatting with flat feet? Then you’ve likely spotted a true gopnik (m) or gopnitsa (f).

item.title: Russian Ruble (₽)
item.description: Value and Denominations A ruble (рубль) isn’t worth much. At the moment, 1 ruble is worth 0.011 euros ( Exchange Rate). So, 100 rubles is about 1 euro. 1 ruble = 100 kopeks, the Russian word for cents. There are coins of 1, 5, 10, and 50 kopeks, and 1, 2, 5, and 10 rubles.

item.title: Russian Superstitions
item.description: Etiquette Besides being amusing and interesting, it’s useful to know some of these. A number of them have become social norms or etiquette. For example, don’t shake hands on the threshold. Don’t give an even number of flowers unless it’s for a funeral.
